timeline.author: zlamalp
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3,6 +3,9 @@
 
 -- this update is not supported on hsql since its used only as in-memory db
 
+3.1.66
+update configurations set value='3.1.65' where property='DATABASE VERSION';

timeline.message:
Core - UUID

* DEPLOYMENT:
  * New DB version
  * Need to enable postgres plugin with command `CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT
EXISTS "pgcrypto";`
* Added UUID to Group, User and Resource entities.
* The UUID is of version 4 and is generated by the DB.

timeline.bodyText: I don't really think this is necessary.  You get the whole new group correctly set with all expected attributes.
timeline.author: stavamichal

replies.bodyText: Actually, it is. Because a lot of code expects the given object to be modified. Without it, a lot of code would have to be rewritten.
replies.author: Vojtech-Sassmann

replies.bodyText: Ok so please just comment it.
replies.author: stavamichal

replies.bodyText:
Regarding this, don't we want to then return group object instead of the newGroup ?
And just a note, it would be so nice to use Postgres INSERT .... RETURNING query, but its not supported by HSQLDB which we use for the tests.
replies.author: zlamalp
